clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Respiratory Variability of R-R Intervals and Systolic Pressure Variability
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between Respiratory Variability of R-R Intervals and in Invasive Systolic Blood Pressure During Changes in Posture and Positive End Expiratory Pressure

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective study is designed to assess and quantify the correlation between respiratory changes in R-R interval and the respiratory changed in invasive systolic blood pressure in ventilated patients during changes in posture and peak end expiratory pressure (PEEP) and following a fluid bolus

primary_outcome.measure: Statistical Correlation between respiratory variability of R-R interval and systolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: From immediately after induction of general anesthesia and mechanical ventilation to 20 minutes later

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patient scheduled for surgery under general anesthesia

intervention.description: Following induction of general anesthesia and initiation of positive pressure ventilation, patients will be tilted 15 degrees head up for 5 minutes with positive end expiratory pressure of 8 cm H2O, and then 15 degrees head down for 5 minutes with positive end expiratory pressure of 3 cm H2O
intervention.arm_group_label: Patient scheduled for surgery under general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-80
- Scheduled for surgery under general anesthesia requiring invasive blood pressure monitoring
Exclusion Criteria:
- Heart Rate other than sinus
- Cardiac Pacemaker Status
- Transplanted Heart
